responses.rationale: Contains the explicit calming keyword 'safe'.
Reports a theoretical risk but lacks explicit calming language or intensified low-risk evaluation.
Contains the explicit calming phrase 'peace of mind'.
Reports susceptibility but lacks explicit calming language.
Reports a low number but lacks explicit calming language.
Reports numbers tested and monitoring but lacks explicit calming language.
Reports an outbreak but lacks explicit calming language.
Describes symptoms but lacks explicit calming language.
Refers to the case as a 'one-off', explicitly minimizing its scale/implication.
Contains the phrase 'don't think the virus itself is necessarily any more worrying', explicitly minimizing worry.
Contains the explicit calming keyword 'safe'.
Bare negation of increased infectiousness; lacks explicit calming language.
Contains the phrase 'don't think the virus itself is necessarily any more worrying', explicitly minimizing worry.
Describes actions being taken but lacks explicit calming language.
Contains the explicit calming phrase 'peace of mind'.
Reports facts but lacks explicit calming language.
Contains the phrase 'mitigate some of the concern', explicitly reducing worry/concern.
Reports experts' views but lacks explicit calming language.
Uses 'extremely rare' to intensify the low risk, an explicit calming cue.
Describes negative events but lacks explicit calming language.
